content.question: A curve in the <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-plane is defined by the parametric equations <math alttext="x of t, equals, 4 times t cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y of t, equals, open parenthesis, 3 times t squared, minus 4, close parenthesis, cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>âˆ’</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the slope of the line tangent to the curve at the point where <math alttext="t equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?
